title: Hermon
content: A mountain, 9400 feet high, in the extreme northeast of the Holy Land, being the southern point of a range of hills called Anti-Libanus. It is visible not only from a great part of Galilee, but also from various places as far south as Jericho. The Hermonites (
) are the three peaks of Mount Hermon. Jewish poetry contains several allusions to this mountain (
